review.p1: Before we begin, let’s take a moment to review what you committed to last time.
review.p2: This helps us encourage each other and see how God is at work.
review.empty: You didn’t write any notes in Look Forward the last time we met. Taking a few notes can help you grow!

para.1: Most people do not explore life’s big questions on their own. We look for insight we can trust and communities where reflection and honest conversation are welcome.
para.2: This site invites you to explore a range of stories and themes drawn from the life and teachings of Jesus, and to consider whether they have anything to say about wisdom, relationships, and everyday life.

ctc.title: Discovering Spiritual Community
ctc.summary: A series of stories that explore community, belonging, and shared life as described in the accounts of Jesus and those around him.

para.1: Across history, people have searched for meaningful connection and a sense of belonging.
para.2: These stories invite you to observe how community forms around shared values, trust, and commitment, and to reflect on what that might mean today.

disciple.title: Passing It On
disciple.summary: Stories and conversations about learning, growth, and influence through relationships.

para.1: Many of Jesus’ conversations focused on learning through example, practice, and shared life.
para.2: As you explore these passages, consider how learning is passed from one person to another and how influence is shaped through everyday relationships.

give.title: Giving and Generosity
give.summary: Stories that explore money, priorities, and generosity in everyday life.

para.1: Questions about money and possessions often reveal what people value most.
para.2: These passages invite reflection on generosity, trust, and how choices about resources shape both individuals and communities.

hope.title: Seven Stories of Hope
hope.summary: Seven stories that describe encounters between Jesus and people facing real-life situations.

para.1: Each story records an interaction with someone experiencing pressure, loss, uncertainty, or change.
para.2: As you read together, notice what happens in each encounter and consider whether any of these stories connect with your own experience of life.

jvideo.title: The Life of Jesus
jvideo.summary: Short videos that introduce Jesus through recorded stories and events from his life.

para.1: As you watch, pay attention to what Jesus says and does, and reflect on how his approach compares with other voices you have encountered.

lead.title: Leadership
lead.summary: Exploring leadership through the words and actions of Jesus.

para.1: The accounts of Jesus present a distinctive approach to leadership shaped by service, responsibility, and care for others.
para.2: These passages invite reflection on what leadership looks like in everyday life and influence.

life.title: Life Issues
life.summary: Stories and teachings that address practical questions about relationships, decisions, and purpose.

para.1: Many of the topics Jesus addressed relate to challenges people still face today.
para.2: As you explore these passages, consider what stands out and whether any of these ideas connect with your own questions about life.

obey.title: Responding to What You Read
obey.summary: Reflecting on response and action in everyday life.

para.1: Every Bible passage invites readers to consider response, whether through reflection, conversation, or changes in attitude or action.
para.2: These conversations create space to think about how ideas move from words on a page into everyday choices and relationships.

relate.title: Relationships
relate.summary: Exploring connection, honesty, and shared life.

para.1: Although people are often connected digitally, many still experience isolation.
para.2: These passages invite reflection on relationships, trust, and how people support one another through life.

serve.title: Serving Others
serve.summary: Stories that explore service, responsibility, and care for others.

para.1: Jesus is often shown serving others in practical and unexpected ways.
para.2: These accounts invite reflection on how service shapes communities and personal values.

share.title: Sharing Stories
share.summary: Conversations about sharing experiences and insights with others.

para.1: Ideas often spread through relationships and everyday conversations.
para.2: These passages invite reflection on how stories are shared and how understanding grows through dialogue.

trust.title: Trust
trust.summary: Exploring trust, reliance, and confidence through recorded stories of Jesus.

para.1: Many of these accounts describe moments where people must decide what or whom they trust.
para.2: As you read, consider how trust is formed, tested, and expressed in real life.
